64 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save Elon Just Walked Away – And His Reason Changes Everything Read More Ads by Ad.Style OGpsywar 55 points 2 days ago What's my dad wearing .. Dunno, but I want one. 😎 permalink award report block reply BeauHD 35 points 2 days ago I wish I had a dad too permalink parent award report block reply Wehavelawsforareason 12 points 2 days ago Real question:
I got a job offer for a job in Dallas. I looked at the demographics and it’s like 24.4% black there according to google. Anyone that can confirm this? I live in a deep blue state and was excited to escape, but I’d rather live in deep blue hell than 24.4% little Africa. permalink parent award report block reply Viewer01 20 points 2 days ago Jogger dodging is a southern staple sad enough to say. Most cities have a demographics map where you can pick a good neighborhood and avoid them for the most part. However you won’t avoid having to deal with them altogether in various public spaces. As they say never relax. Anyways Dallas ain’t bad. The worst spots are probably New Orleans and Atlanta and Memphis. Those are cities you’ll get murdered for your shoes. permalink parent award report block reply makersmarx 20 points 2 days ago Atlanta checking in. Two friends, both white, murdered by young blacks just in the last 10 years. Seperate murders that both started as a robbery permalink parent award report block reply view 2 more comments... Texas is built on good relationships btw, so yeah, be good and good will find you and grow from there effort you put in. God bless. permalink parent award report block reply Overkillengine 7 points 2 days ago I would also inquire about average neighborhood income, property values, and distance from nearest public transport; as those are harder for proglodyte  ideologues to realize why you are asking about them and then try to lie about. You want somewhere with as little access to public transport as possible as that means even with lower class income levels, it forces the residents to behave well enough to afford personal vehicles.
